meta_description: Located in the heart of Historic Philadelphia, the Museum explores the dramatic, surprising story of the American Revolution and its enduring legacy.
hours_text:
# Hours & Admission

Share this page

  * Share on Twitter 
  * Share on Facebook 
  * Share via Email 

Print this page

## Hours

**Museum Hours  
** Daily, 10 a.m. - 5 p.m.  
_The Museum is closed on Sept. 2, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day._

**Cross Keys Café Hours  
** Daily, 10 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

**Museum Shop Hours**  
The Museum Shop is open during the Museum’s operating hours. The Museum’s [**online shop**](https://shop.amrevmuseum.org/) offers a wide range of books, gifts, and apparel for all ages.

**Daily Programs**  
See the [**daily schedule**](https://www.amrevmuseum.org/daily-programs) of talks, films, activities, and more.

**Old City Walking Tours  
** Explore the Museum's historic Old City Philadelphia neighborhood with stops at iconic Revolutionary-era sites on daily [**expert-guided walking tours**](https://www.amrevmuseum.org/visit-tour).

## Admissions

**Family Four-Pack (Online purchase only)** | $64  
---|---  
**Any Day (No need to pick a specific date or time!)** | $27  
**Adults (In-person, walk-up purchase)** | $27  
**Adults (Online purchase only)** | $25  
**Seniors (65 & up)** | $21  
**Students, Teachers, & Military** | $21  
**Youth (6-17)** | $14  
**Members** | FREE  
**Children (5 & under)** | FREE  
**ACCESS Cardholders & SNAP Recipients (Walk-up only)** | FREE  
  
[Buy Tickets  ](https://tickets.amrevmuseum.org/WebStore/shop/viewitems.aspx?CG=mt&C=gatix) [Member Tickets  ](https://tickets.amrevmuseum.org/WebStore/sh...

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

Share this page

  * Share on Twitter 
  * Share on Facebook 
  * Share via Email 

Print this page

The Museum of the American Revolution is committed to making its facilities, exhibits, and programs accessible for all audiences in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). 

Guests are welcome to request accommodations at least two weeks ahead of their planned visit by completing our [**Accessibilty Accommodation Request form**](https://www.amrevmuseum.org/accessibility-accommodation-request). Please contact Guest Services at 267.579.3596 Voice/TTY or [**[email protected]**](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#51383f373e11303c2334273c242234243c7f3e2336) in advance of your visit for any additional assistance you may need.

[Accommodation Request ](https://www.amrevmuseum.org/accessibility-accommodation-request)

## Building Accessibility

The Museum’s main entrance is fully accessible. There is a passenger loading/unloading zone in front of the Museum and benches inside the front doors for guests to await drivers. The entrance doors open automatically when activated by pressing the button adjacent to the door. The Museum has convenient elevators and ramps that make all its public spaces accessible. Manual wheelchairs are available free of charge at the Front Desk for use within the Museum on a first-come, first-serve basis.

## Parking

The Museum does not have any automobile parking facilities. Please refer to [**Directions & Parking**](https://www....

Play/Pause

# The Declaration's Journey

[ Explore ](https://www.amrevmuseum.org/exhibits/the-declaration-s-journey)

The Museum of the American Revolution uncovers and shares compelling stories about the diverse people and complex events that sparked America’s ongoing experiment in liberty, equality, and self-government.

[About the Museum ](https://www.amrevmuseum.org/about)

## At the Museum

Plan your visit to rediscover the Revolution in historic Philadelphia.

[ Explore the Museum ](https://www.amrevmuseum.org/at-the-museum)

### Plan Your Visit

Purchase Museum tickets, enhance your visit with guided tours, and plan your Museum experience with information on directions, parking, shopping, dining, and more.

[ Plan Your Visit ](https://www.amrevmuseum.org/at-the-museum/visit)

### Walking & Guided Tours

Explore the Museum with an expert with the Museum's robust lineup of tours, including early access tours, in-gallery highlights tours, audio tours, outdoor neighborhood walking tours, tactile tours, and more.

[ Learn More ](https://www.amrevmuseum.org/visit-tour)

[Exhibits](https://www.amrevmuseum.org/at-the-museum/exhibits)

### The Declaration's Journey

Open Through January 3, 2027

The Declaration's Journey explores the history and global impact of the Declaration of Independence from 1776 to today and showcases how it has become one of the most influential political documents in modern history.
